think_procedure: To classify whether the 'enable_parallel_hash' knob of PostgreSQL is a 'special knob', we first need to understand what this knob does and its range of values. According to the PostgreSQL documentation, 'enable_parallel_hash' is a boolean setting that enables or disables the use of parallel hash operations. The possible values for this knob are either true (1) or false (0). A special knob typically has a special value that, when set, alters the behavior of the system in a non-standard way compared to other values. In this case, setting 'enable_parallel_hash' to true or false simply turns parallel hashing on or off, respectively, without introducing any non-standard or unique behavior that breaks the natural order or functionality of the system. Thus, the knob does not have a special value outside the standard boolean range that changes its fundamental behavior in an unexpected way.
